snippet: There’s confusion over the text of the deal that Congress just approved and President Obama signed, but it doesn’t kill the debt ceiling.
abstract: News analysis; so-called default prevention section of legislation signed by Pres Obama to reopen government and finance its debt is causing lingering confusion, with many believing that it provides president with permanent authority to unilaterally increase country's debt; provision is in fact only effective until February, 2014.
lead_paragraph: There’s confusion over the text of the deal that Congress just approved and President Obama signed, but it doesn’t kill the debt ceiling.

headline.main: Lingering Confusion in Debt Ceiling Deal’s Temporary Fix
headline.print_headline: Lingering Confusion in Debt Ceiling Deal’s Temporary Fix
